description: About Stockly Stockly is a retail-tech company that targets to solve the problem of out-of-stock products in e-commerce. With our technology, e-retailers can keep selling out-of-stock products, making other retailers ship them directly to consumers. Our product is live across Europe and convinces more clients every day. Our mission is to create the world first global inventory for retail. To better understand what we do, check out  our French pitch at BFMTV , or  our English pitch at Techstars . We are looking for a smart and talented Data Analyst Intern to join the BI team working closely with our CTO  Oscar , our Head of Network  Pierre , our Financial Officer  Etienne  and our Business Developers (e.g.  Matthieu  &  Yann) . The BI is currently composed of  Maria  and  Anouar . You can apply even if it is to start in 6 months! Position [This is not a Data ‚ÄúScientist‚Äù position, there are no Machine Learning or Artificial Intelligence components for now] To tackle our cross team challenges, you are a candidate willing to actively participate to the company development. In our growing team, everyone is key including you as you will be working on the frontier of several domains: Develop and maintain SQL dashboards, to monitor data and analyse performance Extract and interpret data for business requirements Train colleagues on data extraction & interpretation Identify new features to make our product evolve according to usage and needs Everytime you will face recurring tasks or pain points, you will be in charge of finding and implementing solution to tackle this and help the company and team move to next stage. Challenges Tackling an international market in a fast growing startup, you‚Äôll have three main challenges: ‚Ä¢  Complexity : a lot can happen in an e-commerce transaction, specially when you connect multiple players. ‚Ä¢  Performance : Stockly manages tens of millions of articles, that‚Äôs a hell of a lot of web requests per day. ‚Ä¢  Scalability : Being focus on growth, we require that published code still work with ten times more volume. üíù About your future benefits Competitive packages : for this position, package range is typically  1500-2000‚Ç¨  depending on the profile (e.g. basic knowledge to expert). We have a well defined and objective salary grid that is based on both  skills level  and  scarcity of profiles  üí∏ Meal vouchers  by Swile üçΩÔ∏è 50%  reimbursement of your  Navigo Pass  üöã A central and amazing  working environment  in  le Sentier  (Paris) üíº Flexible and  remote-friendly policy  üè° Possibility to take a  few paid days-off  to be discussed with Team Leader üèÑ Stockly dinners  together every other Thursday üçª Stockly breakfasts together  every other Friday ü•ê Coffee, tea and fruits  available everyday üçá Climbing, football & more  teams üßó If your internship goes well for both you and Stockly, why not join us?  We are growing fast, there is space for every amazing people! ‚öôÔ∏è About how we work Every team has a  daily meeting  to align on priorities and solve issues ‚áí  You won‚Äôt be left alone! Every Monday we have a global  weekly meeting  where every team shares what they are working on and what they will do for the coming week ‚áí  You will have visibility on the whole company! Every quarter we have our  OKR meeting  ( Objectives, Key Results)  where each team shows the results of the previous quarter and the objectives of the following one ‚áí  You will see the company grow and your own role inside of it! During all these meetings  everyone can challenge  each other and all questions are more than welcome ‚áí  Transparency is one of our key values, and we are always open to new ideas!
description_entreprise: üî≠  Stockly  is a  tech-retail company  solving the supply/demand mismatch in e-commerce. With our technology,  we connect in real-time e-commerce websites  in need for stock  with the inventory of hundreds of other retailers  who have the same products available, and who can fulfill the order on their behalf. E-retailers can  sell products they don‚Äôt own , while others can gain additional sales, in a  seamless experience for the end-consumer . üèÜ Our mission is to create the  world‚Äôs 1st globally shared inventory  for retail. To better understand what we do, check out  our french pitch at BFMTV  (üá´üá∑), or  our English pitch at Techstars  (üá¨üáß). üöÄ We‚Äôve already raised  $20M+  with European top-tier investors among which  Daphni ,  Eurazeo  and  Raise . description: Whatever their stage of life, we provide over 108 million customers with the products and services they need to progress. Main purpose The intern will gather and analyze financial and economic data to assess investment backdrop and opportunities. The intern will also maintain and improve the existing economic and financial databases and tools and may build new ones.  The intern will report to the Senior Credit Strategist and will work closely with other team members. Nous g√©rons un portefeuille d'environ 200 000 sinistres par le biais d'√©quipes locales, de deux centres de programmes mondiaux (Autriche et Hong Kong) et de deux centres de services partag√©s (Inde et Pologne). Nos polices couvrent plus de 30 branches d'activit√© et 14 pays, et elles sont souvent incluses dans des programmes couvrant plus de 200 pays.  Au sein de l'√©quipe Sinistres APAC Europe, notre objectif est de (i) piloter la strat√©gie et la transformation de nos activit√©s en mati√®re de sinistres dans l'ensemble de nos zones g√©ographiques, (ii) soutenir les responsables des sinistres et leurs ~500 sp√©cialistes des sinistres pour g√©rer les sinistres de nos entreprises clientes (en particulier sur les op√©rations, les donn√©es et les analyses et le service √† la client√®le), et (iii) surveiller les sinistres et les activit√©s de traitement des sinistres, ainsi que les risques et les contr√¥les qui y sont li√©s. Pour ce faire, nous travaillons en √©troite collaboration sur les projets avec les responsables locaux des sinistres et leurs talents, ainsi qu'avec les centres d'excellence mondiaux des sinistres et les autres d√©partements de la Business Unit APAC Europe (souscription, conseil en risques, op√©rations et technologie, finances, gestion des clients et des courtiers, strat√©gie, gestion des risques, RH‚Ä¶). Notre √©quipe internationale cr√©√©e il y a 2 ans fonctionne avec des membres bas√©s √† Paris, Dublin, Madrid et Londres, et interagit avec des √©quipes √† travers le monde notamment aux Etats-Unis (si√®ge d'AXA XL). Ce que vous ferez Nous renfor√ßons notre √©quipe avec un(e) Senior Claims Data Analysts exceptionnel(le). Vous serez rattach√©(e) au responsable du service et de la transformation des sinistres, et vous aurez deux responsabilit√©s principales : S√©curiser l'analyse de nos donn√©es sur une base mensuelle, trimestrielle et annuelle (au niveau APAC Europe et au niveau pays). Nous pensons que nous devons am√©liorer de mani√®re significative la fa√ßon dont nous mesurons et analysons nos sinistres (pertes) et nos activit√©s de sinistres, notamment parce que la compr√©hension de notre portefeuille de sinistres et l'am√©lioration de nos op√©rations sont cruciales pour la rentabilit√© d'AXA XL.  Pour y parvenir, votre r√¥le sera crucial : 
 vous devrez remettre en question et analyser un ensemble de donn√©es, comprendre les moteurs de changement et traduire votre analyse en commentaires pertinents pour nos parties prenantes senior. 
 Vous devrez comprendre en profondeur les sp√©cificit√©s et les r√©serves des indicateurs (d√©finitions, port√©e, calcul, y compris les objectifs), des syst√®mes de gestion des sinistres et des outils d'information g√©ographique. Pour √™tre pertinente, votre analyse reposera sur des interactions structur√©es et fr√©quentes avec des experts de notre organisation, et vous serez responsable de la fiabilit√© des donn√©es.  Les m√©triques comprendront des indicateurs de performance cl√©s li√©s √† : (i) les activit√©s li√©es aux sinistres et les initiatives du plan d'action (productivit√©, d√©penses, √©conomies, personnel, recouvrement, fraude, service des sinistres, conformit√©‚Ä¶), (ii) les donn√©es sur les sinistres (grands sinistres (caus√©s par l'homme et Nat Cats) et sinistres attritionnels ; sinistres sensibles ; litiges ; crises (par ex. Covid19, conflit en Ukraine) et tendances (par ex. inflation)) et (iii) les op√©rations de sinistres (mesures li√©es aux processus de traitement des sinistres (par ex. d√©lai moyen de la premi√®re r√©serve) et aux flux de donn√©es sur les sinistres). 
 Contribuer √† la conduite du changement et √† l'am√©lioration continue en mati√®re d'analyse des donn√©es.  Nous pensons que notre organisation des sinistres doit √©voluer pour mieux saisir et analyser les donn√©es, √©tant donn√© que dans le cadre de notre feuille de route de transformation, nous allons (devoir) avoir acc√®s √† de plus en plus de points de donn√©es. Par cons√©quent 
 vous devrez √™tre un agent de changement au quotidien avec nos √©quipes Sinistres tout au long de leur parcours d'analyse des donn√©es : vous serez leur " source unique de v√©rit√© " pour les donn√©es dans le secteur Sinistres APAC Europe,

En parall√®le, vous contribuerez activement √† notre parcours de donn√©es en travaillant en √©troite collaboration avec nos parties prenantes mondiales en mati√®re de sinistres et de donn√©es, par exemple en sugg√©rant comment am√©liorer l'efficacit√© de nos processus de reporting (par exemple en limitant les entr√©es manuelles, en optimisant les flux de donn√©es) et comment donner la priorit√© aux d√©veloppements informatiques et de donn√©es. Pour ces responsabilit√©s, vous vous engagerez avec les parties prenantes au sein de Claims (y compris le Head of Claims Finance, les Country Heads of Claims et leurs √©quipes) et au-del√† de Claims (par exemple, Finance, Underwriting, Risk management, si n√©cessaire).

description: Context on the Data Integration Data is a cornerstone for Seyna. Data will allow us to differentiate ourselves from our competition and it will help us protect the future of our insurance company. This can only become true if our data is of high quality, and efficiently processed. We exchange with more partners daily: we receive data from the brokers and distributors that sell our products, then analyze and process it, before sharing our results and insights with our ecosystem. Exchanging data with our partners presents an increasing challenge as our business grows : increasing volume, data diversity, and increasingly diverse sources. The Data Integration Manager makes sure exchanging data with Seyna is as easy for our partners, while still meeting our internal requirements. She also owns the quality of the data - checking that the data we received is correct. Your Missions: As a Data Integration Manager you will : Help our partners with their data integration process (onboarding and run) Design custom APIs on a day-to-day basis, for each new partner integrating with Seyna Work with our Data Engineer to make the integration as easy as possible. Collect the partner‚Äôs data. If not fully automated, you integrate it yourself into Seyna‚Äôs ecosystem. Check data consistency regarding accounting & business rules (e.g. premium acquisition rate vs receipt emission, reinsurance cession rate, written premium vs receipt emission‚Ä¶) Automate the data quality process and make it more efficient Assist the team with the data monitoring and data analysis Shape the future of data integration at Seyna ! Our Current Stack Data integration Deployed on AWS with AWS CDK (IaC) Coded in Python

By building their business on Seyna‚Äôs platform, brokers can create unique and personalized insurance experiences, from underwriting to claims handling. The platform automates administrative and compliance tasks, freeing up brokers‚Äô time to spend with policyholders. Seyna‚Äôs goal is to shift the ‚Ç¨560Bn EU P&C market onto Seyna‚Äôs platform. And they‚Äôre off to a great start. The leadership team includes experienced operators from insurance and high growth technology companies. Seyna raised ‚Ç¨47 million total investment from Global Founders Capital, White Star Capital, Elaia, Allianz and La Financi√®re Saint James ‚Äì including a record ‚Ç¨33 million Series A in December 2021. Since its launch in 2019, when Seyna acquired an insurance company license, the platform has enabled over 100 insurance brokers who use Seyna to protect over 1 million policyholders. They have a very ambitious mission with tough problems to work on. It‚Äôll only be possible if we have the best team. Join us !

description_entreprise: Yubo is a live social discovery app launched in 2015, with the ambition to create a space where Gen Z can belong, feel safe and make friends. With more than 70 million users worldwide across 140 countries, we celebrate the true essence of being young, and make it easy to connect with others wherever you are. We are a French Tech company, part of the Next120, and our mission is to inspire and enable a new generation to find out about the world and themselves. Yubo‚Äôs business model is different from other social networks: in-app purchases and subscriptions. Yubo‚Äôs growth relies on paid UA, not virality. Our objective is to become the safest social app in the world. Indeed, as leading platform for young people to socialize online, we have a special responsibility towards our community to building a safe digital space, and we take it very seriously. Safety is at the core of our DNA, and we have developed and implemented a wide range of safeguards in the app. We also work closely with the broader technology industry, NGOs and charities to create industry-leading child protection standards. We really have a proactive approach to protect, support and educate.

description: üë´ About the team Helping the company be fully data-driven is not just a buzzword, it is our mission at Equativ. Our values are just as important within Evaneos. Our strength is in our diversity: our multitude of languages, backgrounds, and experiences. description: We are looking for a Data/Business Analyst who is deeply passionate about data-driven decisions, transforming raw data into clear actionable business insights, and who is constantly driving themselves and the team towards completing the next challenge. By joining this team, you will have a strong impact on the business and a unique opportunity to reach hundreds of millions of users with your insights and recommendations. Build and manage robust data pipelines to align with ever-evolving business needs, ensuring optimal architecture support. Develop dashboards and reports to foster company-wide comprehension of key business metrics and growth performance Analyzing large, complex data sets representing the behavior of millions of online and mobile game players to address strategic and operational business questions Manage multiple projects at a time in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment Be in direct contact with the business stakeholders and help our Growth Team better understand the data in order to optimise our User Acquisition and Monetization processes Profile You possess substantial experience in analytical roles, ideally within a web or mobile company or the social networks industry You are skilled in SQL, Python or Excel You have practical experience with Tableau or a visualisation tool, and can create dashboards that are shared company-wide, facilitating data-driven decision-making across departments. You enjoy being in contact with stakeholders and help them achieve their business goals A Master's degree in a top engineering or business school, in statistics, Math, Engineering, Economy, or other quantitative fields is mandatory for this role. Advanced knowledge of statistical tools and models will be considered a significant advantage.
description_entreprise: Voodoo is a tech company that creates mobile games and apps. With 7 billion downloads and over 150 million monthly active users, Voodoo is the #3 mobile publisher worldwide in terms of downloads after Google and Meta. The company is one of the most impressive examples of hypergrowth in the ecosystem, having raised over $1B and backed by Goldman Sachs, Tencent, and GBL. Voodoo is now a team of over 750 employees worldwide, we‚Äôre looking for talented individuals from across the globe to come and entertain the world with us.

description: Data Analysis & Strategic Insights : Dive deep into complex data sets representing shopper behavior to extract actionable insights. Your analyses will inform strategic decisions, helping to refine product features, improve unit economics, and guide the development of future product roadmaps. CRM & Buyer Journey Optimization : Oversee the management of customer relationships, with a focus on enhancing the buyer journey. Utilize data-driven strategies to increase engagement, improve retention, and drive sales on the platform. Cross-functional Data Collaboration : Work closely with various departments, including marketing, product development, and sales, to provide data-driven insights. Your role will be crucial in ensuring that decisions across the company are informed by robust, analytical insights. Operational Data Management : Monitor key business metrics and manage the operational aspects of data analysis and CRM. Build and maintain automated dashboards and reports to enhance company-wide understanding of key metrics and shopper experiences. Marketplace Insights & Innovation : Actively contribute to the evolution of the platform by using data insights to identify new opportunities for marketplace expansion and innovation. Your role will involve spotting trends, predicting future market demands, and proposing strategies to attract and retain users, reinforcing Jamble's position as a leader in the sustainable fashion marketplace. Project Management & Execution : Manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment. Ensure that data analysis and CRM strategies are executed effectively, aligning with Jamble's broader goals and contributing to the platform's success. Profile At least 2-4 years of experience in a Data Analyst or Data Science role BA/B.Sc in Statistics / Math / Engineering/ Economy or other quantitative fields Strong Excel skills Advanced knowledge of statistical tools and models is an advantage At least two years of analytical work experience, preferably for a web or mobile company, or in the e-commerce industry Strong SQL with experience in querying large, complex data sets Experience working with Amplitude High level of analytical and problem-solving skills with strong attention to details Ability to turn complex concepts into actionable recommendations Fluent in French, High proficiency in English Benefits Lunch vouchers (Swile) Healthcare (Alan) Desk at Voodoo‚Äôs office (awarded Best Office Space in Paris)

description: Our Mission At Prose, we don‚Äôt believe in ‚Äúone-size-fits-most.‚Äù We create custom hair care that‚Äôs inclusive to all hair types, needs, and preferences. Each of our hair care products is customized to a person‚Äôs hair needs based on the results from an online consultation. The individual data is processed through a proprietary algorithm and made-to-order in the Prose lab using natural active ingredients. Marrying emerging technologies with the best in beauty, Prose is truly creating something special. This is the opportunity to join a fast-growing startup and an energetic team that works together to deliver creative solutions that are transforming the way people think about and shop for hair care. We‚Äôre looking for talented problem solvers who lead with passion and who face any task with a positive mindset. Position Summary Prose is looking for a Senior Business Analyst II to join our Business Analytics team, a new role within a new team. This leader will help drive our analytics practices across the customer journey, from prospect/acquisition to retention, nurture and grow the analytics team, and build strong relationships with key stakeholders across the Prose organization from our (amazing) Growth and Digital Product teams to our (strong) Data Engineering and Data Sciences teams in Paris.  This role is vital to building out Prose‚Äôs analytics function and will assist in driving the education of the organization around analytics, protocols, and implementations, enhance the team's abilities to report on performance, focus on impact, and provide transparency about critical analytics workstreams. This role will partner with key stakeholders to help inform our learning agendas around growth, retention and digital product.   Key Responsibilities This individual should thrive in the opportunity to provide solutions/answers for questions challenging our teams across the customer journey: Growth, Digital Product and Brand Partner with key stakeholders across the organization to increase efficiencies, insights and drive decision-making  Design and oversee measurement framework implementations that answer key questions for our stakeholders e.g.,  for digital product: funnel optimization, for growth - attribution models, retention - email benchmarking Understand, and be proactive in seeking new and innovative solutions to solve business measurement challenges Develop proof of concepts and requirements for advanced analytics needs to partner with our Data Science team in Paris Communicate findings and recommendations coming out of analyses to key stakeholders ‚Äã‚ÄãCollaborate with stakeholders across the organization to bring reporting to life Lead, validate, monitor and troubleshoot tagging and tracking for measurement Document work, prioritize data governance and evangelize best practices Proactively seek out and investigate new technologies to advance Prose‚Äôs analytics practice Support other ad-hoc requests as needed included but not limited to building of dashboards, Looker trainings and onboardings and light analysis Serve as resident analytics advocate Key Candidate Requirements We‚Äôd love to hear from you if‚Ä¶ You have deep analytics experience (5+ years) in related areas: product management, strategy, consulting, marketing/customer/product analytics, data science, or equivalent fields You have an understanding of business metrics such as CAC, LTV, Conversion Rates and can apply them to your decision making and prioritization as well as creating and managing analysis frameworks You understand and can translate between business requirements and the tools that are necessary to address business needs You understand statistics and base models such as linear and logistic regression and are familiar with other techniques such as segmentation methods and time series analysis, outlier and anomaly detection, categorical data analysis, and causal impact modeling You have experience with designing and analyzing experiments e.g., A/B tests You have an enthusiasm for conducting reproducible analysis; we believe in code review, version control, and solid documentation You have a drive to learn and master new technologies and techniques You are eager to build a best in class business analytics practice from the ground up You are proactive and collaborative, you enjoy working with others up, across and down the organization Technologies you will use: Google Cloud Platform: (BigQuery, DataFlow, Kubernetes Engine + Pub/Sub) and we are open to adopting new tools as we grow! Airflow for data pipelining Python or R for machine learning algorithms and analysis Looker for business intelligence and consumer facing dashboards Heap for web analytics Many more to come - be part of the team that decides! Perks & Benefits Competitive compensation package (base salary, target bonus and equity) Health insurance (Alan Blue 100% covered by Prose) + tickets restaurants Nice and trendy office located between Opera and Grands Boulevards (Paris, 2eme) Choice between a gym membership (ClassPass) or an electric bike (Vanmoof) to commute easily to the office  On-going training and development programs  An abundance of office snacks Prose values Intentional Inclusivity We know the best ideas come from open minds and willingness to listen. While our products cater to the individual, an invitation into our process is always open to our community. We value our differences and diverse backgrounds by communicating openly, managing with transparency and striving to understand one another‚Äôs perspective. It‚Äôs a key ingredient to our innovation. Connected Collaboration Our strength as a group will outlast our efforts as individual contributors. With offices across countries (and across boroughs) staying inventive and agile deepens our clear vision and consistent communication. We stay in a spirit of entrepreneurial collaboration: We do not have consensus at all times, but we trust one another to work toward our common goals. Our success is an expression and result of our progressive and gratifying teamwork. Driven, Together We value ownership and coaching that encourages employees to think constructively and creatively about the business. We view employees as leaders and individuals who are accountable, resourceful and responsible. Anyone and everyone is encouraged to lead. We recognize that in order to continue thinking one step ahead, we will need to try new things. We strive to provide an open environment that accepts this truth making space for new ideas to emerge. Humanity Always We assume good intentions in every interaction keeping ourselves accountable for the climate we create. We seek to understand our co-workers through this lens of conscious bienveillance, authenticity and fellowship. We operate with the intention of preserving resources, creating an environment we can all live in ‚Äî for our business and the world. Sustainable care is essential to our ethos as an organization. We take a mindful approach to how we think about our people (employees) and our planet.
